answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Tanya,
Thank you for the question about innovations in dog licensing programs. Below are a few articles that may give you some new ideas for your program. In addition you can check out a list of all the documents relating to animal control http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/topic_documents/10/animal_control
•   In the case study  “Animal Services-Creating a Win-Win” the county of Washoe shares some innovative practices they have been implementing in an attempt to increase dog licensing in their area. icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/8108
•   In the article “Carlsbad, CA’s Low-Cost Animal Microchipping” an innovative event centering around animal microchipping and licensing is discussed. http://icma.org/en/Article/11151/Carlsbad_CAs__LowCost_Animal_Microchipping
I hope these articles give provide you with some useful examples of what other communities are doing.
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Tanya Ange
text: I am looking for innovative methods of dog licensing.  We are considering eliminating dog licensing and replacing the process with a business license (vets) that would require the business to submit rabies records.  Has anyone explored such a process or have any other innovative ways to license dogs?
title: Dog Licensing
